info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 1:40PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Slippery Morning Commute on Monday... A cold front will advance south from Canada and across North Central and Central Montana through the morning hours on Monday. While snow is expected to be the primary precipitation type following the passage of the front, a brief period of rain may occur with the initial passage of the front before air temperatures cool sufficiently. Any rain falling onto the cold ground will freeze and lead to slippery conditions, especially on elevated surfaces like bridges and overpasses. As temperatures cool the rain will quickly change to snow, with snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches then being possible through the afternoon hours on Monday, with localized higher amounts in the mountains. Be prepared for slippery travel conditions, especially during the morning hours on Monday, and allow for extra time to reach your destination.
